intro: Cheiridopsis scabra var. fera, commonly known as the roughleaf ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating, aiding in water retention. Its flowers are typically bright yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
